page.title: 01Burlton and low lying ground
page.content: The overiding feature of the area is its flatness, although there are two areas of higher ground, Pelton Hill (91 mtrs) and Myddle Hill. There is only one main centre of population, Burlton, which has 89 people,other people living in isolate farms and cottages. Farming accounts for most of the land cover but only some of the population. The farms vary in size from about 20 acres to about 400 acres The soil types vary from a small aea of grade 2 to grade 4. Most soils ae of the heavy clay type, while on the lower lying ground peaty soils Predominate, The large ares of clay soils allow growing of either grass or winer sown cereals. The main livestock enterprise is dairy cattle, with some sheep. There are also small wooded areas, which add natural beauty to the area.
